MPILearner module¶

class MPILearner.MPILearner¶

Bases: shiva.learners.Learner.Learner

launch() → None¶

Initialization function. * Connects with the IOHandler * Creates the MPI port where trajectories are gonna arrived (from the MPIEnv) * Initializes algorithm, creates agents and replay buffer * Hand shake with the Meta Learner * Connects with MultiEnv (soon to be deprecated as there’s no communication going on)

Returns

None

run() → None¶

Training loop where we execute high level functions: * Check and receive trajectories * Run algorithmic updates * Run evolution (if PBT enabled) * Plot metrics on Tensorboard (using ShivaAdmin)

Returns

None

check_incoming_trajectories() → None¶

This function iterates for `n_traj_pulls`_ times over all the MPIEnv groups and tries to pull a trajectory from their queue if there is any there. Also profiles time spent between pulls and logs.

Returns

None

receive_trajectory_numpy(env_comm: mpi4py.MPI.Comm) → None¶

If the MPI queue has an available trajectory to be pulled we are gonna pull it and push it into the local replay buffer.

Parameters

env_comm (MPI.Comm) – MPI communication object. For more information go to mpi4py docs

Returns

None

run_updates() → None¶

The core training occurs here where we call algorithm.update(). Before updating performs Meta Learning by decaying learning rate if necessary. Also saves new checkpoints.

Returns

None

run_lr_decay() → None¶

Check if we need to do Learning Rate decay by looking at the last mean rewards. See Learner config explanation for more details on usage.

Returns

None

run_evolution() → None¶

This functions is only executed when PBT is enabled. It will check if it’s time to evolve and will ask a evolution config to the Meta Learner. Once a new evolution config is received it will proceed with the evolution procedures for exploitation and exploration given by the Meta Learner.

Returns

None

create_agents() → List[shiva.agents.Agent.Agent]¶

Initialization function where we create the agents or load the agents for continue training or to be evaluated.

Returns

List[Agent]

get_agent_of_id(id: int) → shiva.agents.Agent.Agent¶

For a given Agent ID, returns the Agent.

Parameters

id (int) – Agent ID

Returns

Agent

create_algorithm() → shiva.algorithms.Algorithm.Algorithm¶

Initialization function.

Returns

Algorithm

create_buffer() → shiva.buffers.ReplayBuffer.ReplayBuffer¶

Initialization function

Returns

ReplayBuffer

checkpoint(checkpoint_num: int, function_only: bool, use_temp_folder: bool) → None¶

Performs the checkpoint saving using ShivaAdmin.

Parameters

  • checkpoint_num (int) – current checkpoint number

  • function_only (bool) – if we want to use ShivaAdmin as a function_only helper. Used for distributed architecture!

  • use_temp_folder (bool) – If True, checkpoints will be saved in the ‘last’ folder. If False, a new checkpoint folder will be created.

Returns

None

t_test(agent: shiva.agents.Agent.Agent, evo_config: Dict) → None¶
Parameters

  • agent (Agent) – Agent that is being tested with the t_test metric. If t_test passes, Agent will be truncated with the Evo Agent.

  • evo_config (Dict) – evolution config. For more information look at the Meta Learner generating evolution configs.

Returns

None

welch_T_Test(evals: numpy.ndarray, evo_evals: numpy.ndarray) → bool¶

Performs the t_test between the rewards distribution of our local agent and the evo agent.

Parameters

  • evals (np.ndarray) – rewards obtained by our Agent on the last evaluation run

  • evo_evals (np.ndarray) – rewards obtained by the Evo Agent on the last evaluation run

Returns

indicating if the p value between both reward distributions is less than the config p_value

Return type

bool

truncation(agent, evo_config) → None¶

Performs truncation. Loads the Evo Agent where our Agent is gonna truncate from.

Parameters

  • agent (Agent) – Agent being truncated

  • evo_config (Dict) – Evolution config containing path where we can load the Evo Agent

Returns

None

perturb(agent: shiva.agents.Agent.Agent) → None¶

Performs hyperparameter perturbation. Note that when using a central critic algorithm we also call the Algorithm.

Parameters

agent (Agent) – Agent who we are perturbing the hyperparameters.

Returns

None

resample(agent: shiva.agents.Agent.Agent) → None¶

Performs hyperparameters resampling. Note that when using a central critic algorithm we also call the Algorithm.

Parameters

agent (Agent) – Agent who we are resampling hyperparameters for.

Returns

None

get_learner_specs() → Dict¶

Creates a new Learner spec depending on the current state of the Learner.

Returns

Dict

get_metrics(agent_id: int) → List[Union[List[Tuple[str, float, int]], Tuple[str, float, int]]]¶

Collects the metrics from * Agent * Environment (received with the trajectory)

Parameters

agent_id (int) – Agent ID for which we want to get the metrics from.

Returns

list of metrics or list of list of metrics

Return type

List[Union[List[Tuple[str, float, int]], Tuple[str, float, int]]]

set_default_configs() → None¶

Cleans a bit the config and set some default values.

Returns

None

close()¶

Notify the Meta Learner that we are closing, and then close all connections.

Returns

None
